direction.raw_text: Yeah... (long beat) ...I love you too. 58   INT. ELEMENTARY SCHOOL - CLASSROOM - MORNING                 58 Kate stands at the BLACKBOARD -- teaching addition and subtraction to the class. A little girl -- ISABEL -- raises her hand.                       *

direction.raw_text: ? No -- of course not!

direction.raw_text: `Cause my mom says that when you kill a baby you go to hell and you can't even go to church to ask god for forgiveness. The students begin to WHISPER to each other. Another boy -- TOBY -- asks -- TOBY Mrs. Hannah -- are you going to hell?

direction.raw_text: No! I didn't kill my baby! Okay, listen kids -- we shouldn't be talking about this. But... (beat) ...sometimes women get pregnant and then early on -- before it's even a baby -- they stop being pregnant.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- not because a doctor   murdered it. (beat) It's called a miscarriage.   That means it wasn't my plan --   it's just what happened. (composes herself) Does anyone want to ask me   any questions? The class nods but seems silently freaked out.

direction.raw_text: Let's get back to subtraction -- or addition. Or both. 59   INT. ELEMENTARY SCHOOL - TEACHERS' LOUNGE - DAY        59 Kate sits with Mr. Davies eating lunch.

direction.raw_text: Well, that was bound to happen at some point. Kids notice things like that. Kate nods.

direction.raw_text: But I had no idea how pro-life little Winnie Reddy is.                        * (beat) Remind me to wear my "May the fetus you save be gay" T-shirt to the next banana split night. Kate half-laughs.

direction.raw_text: Well, the good thing is that it's all over now. Principal Barnes will think you're a martyr for losing a baby. (beat) The kids won't ask about it anymore and as long as you don't toss your cookies again you won't have to deal with it.

direction.raw_text: Great, well -- I'm glad I'm not actually having a baby.

direction.raw_text: God, Kate -- come on. What else were you supposed to do?

direction.raw_text: Well, I feel like a piece of shit for lying.

direction.raw_text: It's not that big a deal. Jesus. Is this what those meetings teach you? To make drama out of nothing?

direction.raw_text: Oh, boy...

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lady, you're done.

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a teensy bit...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not in the slightest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...you might want to consider investing in glasses, buddy. `Cause I'm a...a stone cold fox. And I'm smart. And I'm... Kate begins to cry.

direction.raw_text: I think it's time for you to go home. Now are you gonna let me call a cab?

direction.raw_text: (suddenly angry)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! I'm not. I've got friends. They'll pick me up.

direction.raw_text: I'll call Mr. Davies. He has dreams about me. The bartender takes a long look at Kate -- as though he's trying to size up if she's insane.

direction.raw_text: Hope that works out for you.

direction.raw_text: Can't believe my luck. I just want to get drunk and a bartender won't let me. (beat) Life is stupid. Kate stands up -- almost falling over -- and glares at the bartender.

direction.raw_text: Kate! Are you sure you're -- KATE (over her shoulder) Fuck off. 69   INT. direction.raw_text: Don't be cute with me. You know what I mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So...I guess you aren't doing the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: thing anymore?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What gave that away? Kate turns and goes to the kitchen -- -- reappearing a moment later with a BOTTLE OF TEQUILA, salt and limes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, baby -- let's do some shots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm celebrating. What the fuck does it look like? Kate takes a shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you gonna be a little girl or are you gonna drink with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what the right thing to do here is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, so let me see if this makes sense: you say you miss the old Kate -- the Kate who drinks and blacks out and has fun. (beat) Well...here she is. Kate smiles -- but she looks more desperate and drunk than fun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby, I didn't mean that. I was just being a jerk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck yeah you were. And what? Now you won't drink with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Having a beer or something is one thing, but...I think you really may have a problem. Kate LAUGHS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well thanks for all the support when I was trying to be sober! Kate takes another shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. I didn't realize -- KATE Of course you didn't realize! You don't fucking care about me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?! Of course I care about you. I love you. Kate takes a shot and approaches Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you too. Love is the easy part. It's the rest of the shit that's hard. Kate kisses Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take off your pants. Charlie gently pushes Kate away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look -- I think you should get to sleep. You're really wasted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't wanna sleep. I wanna fuck. Kate pulls Charlie -- who struggles -- down to the couch...and straddles him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, will you stop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! I want you to fuck me! Charlie calmly tries to move Kate off of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really. This is weird.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be a man and fuck your wife! Charlie -- who's creeped out now -- forcefully pushes Kate off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Jesus -- what the fuck is wrong with you? Kate has become quite angry and belligerent by this point -- and begins picking up HOUSEHOLD OBJECTS and throwing them at Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With me? With me?! What the fuck is wrong with me? I try hard and I get shit on! Fucked up family, fired from my job -- this marriage. Nothing's wrong with me! What's wrong with YOU?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate, you need to -- KATE What? What? What do I need? I can't drink because I'm crazy or something and I can't stay sober because of you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're blaming other people for your problems. Kate picks the tequila bottle back up, takes a sip, then -- -- runs at Charlie and tackles him to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it! You're acting like a freak! Kate rips Charlie's SHIRT -- -- and holds the bottle over his head while straddling him, as if she's about to hit him with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! What's wrong with you? Kate holds the bottle in the air and looks hard at Charlie. She begins to weep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't be sober and be with you. Kate gets a flash of anger again and just as it seems like she's about to hit Charlie with the bottle, she -- -- upturns the bottle and begins to chug the tequila. Charlie tries to yank the bottle away, but Kate holds on tight. With the bottle at Kate's lips -- and tequila pouring down her chin -- the couple wrestles for control of the bottle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CUT TO BLACK. FADE IN: 70   INT. JENNY'S CATERING BUSINESS - KITCHEN - DAY                 70   * Kate wears a UNIFORM and carefully works on a CAKE.                 * On the other side of the kitchen, Jenny makes APPETIZERS.           *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's it coming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You tell me. Jenny walks over and tries the icing.                               *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nods with approval)                                  * Delicious.                                                *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (proud) Thanks. 71   INT. CHURCH - AA MEETING ROOM - NIGHT                          71 A middle-aged MAN stands at a podium in front of a medium sized group of PEOPLE -- about twenty-five or so, including Kate, Jenny, and Mr. Davies -- and says --                          *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At this meeting we give cakes to celebrate sober birthdays. We have one birthday tonight -- for Kate, for one year. (beat) Jenny and Dave are giving her the                         * cake. Kate hugs everyone -- then blows out ONE CANDLE on a CAKE before standing at the podium.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I'm Kate, alcoholic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Kate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've heard that your best day drinking is worse than your worst day sober. (beat) Well...that is SO not true! I had amazing times drinking, dancing, and laughing...feeling like the most adorable, charming girl in the world. And I was adorable. (beat) I'd piss my pants, but I was still cute. People in the crowd LAUGH a little bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I first tried getting sober, I figured that as long as I didn't drink...everything else would just magically work out. But it didn't. (beat) My marriage fell apart. I got fired from my job. And that shit happened
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! I never read that in any pamphlet... (shakes her head) ...that isn't what I signed up for. (beat) Um...so, I relapsed. Another shitty slogan I've heard in the rooms is that when you're sober for a bit and drink again "the disease waits for you, picks up where it left off." (beat) I'm sorry you guys, but I HATE those slogans. They all sound like bumper stickers. But, I have to admit...for me, that last one is pretty damn true. (beat) When I drink...I become another person. And that person is a pretty big asshole. Well, unless you want to give me drugs or buy me drinks -- then that person is awesome. People knowingly LAUGH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wasn't happy being the "good-time girl," though. And honestly, I wasn't very good at it. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) My life is really different than it was a year ago. I live alone. I'm bored a lot more. I have a job that pays a lot less. (beat) I'm thankful for the program -- for my friends in here who took the time to help me and give a shit about me. Kate glances at Jenny and Mr. Davies.                             *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are people that used to be a part of my life that I miss -- a lot -- but... (long beat) ...I'm really grateful for this boring new life of mine. Kate smiles and steps down from the podium as people CLAP. 72   INT. BAR - NIGHT                                             72   * Charlie, Owen, and a woman -- MILLIE -- stand at the bar, drinking BEER and WHISKEY SHOTS. Owen speaks -- but Millie seems way more into Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was in North Carolina for a while                     *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Durham -- playing minor league ball. I had some real heat. That's when I met Crash, here. (gestures to Charlie) He'd been sent down to single-A to teach me how to carry myself as a pro ball-player. We got involved with the same woman -- an older chick -- but Crash won her in the end. (beat) He's really taught me some...important life-lessons. Millie nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow...that's a pretty crazy way to meet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. It is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys are sorta like that movie...what's it called?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (plays dumb) I don't know. Which one? (to Charlie) Do you know what movie she means? Charlie -- who's pretty hammered -- shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Bull"...something? What is it? Charlie and Owen feign ignorance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever. It'll come to me. (to Charlie; flirty) So...what do you do now, Crash?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I write about music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? Owen gestures to a WAITRESS to bring THREE MORE SHOTS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...I do freelance for a lot of magazines. But print really is dead. So now most of my stuff winds up on websites. Which is depressing. `Cause you can't hold it -- you can just look at it. It's like... Charlie seems lost in drunken thought. Long, awkward silence. Millie puts her hand on Charlie's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were talking about writing for websites and you kinda trailed off, honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (trying to save the situation) So, Crash -- why don't you tell this nice lady about the 21 days you were up in "The Show," and what the crowds were like, and -- CHARLIE It was crazy. I... Charlie drifts off for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Millie) I'm sorry -- I'm sure you're a great lady. You have lovely hands and hair but... Charlie begins to walk away, wobbly on his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I'm gonna go to the...I'm just gonna go. Charlie stumbles off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as Charlie leaves) You want a ride...? Charlie exits the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Owen) Um...is he cool to drive?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, he'll be fine -- on his bicycle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He rides a bicycle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yeah -- (smiles)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as a teenager, he was a bike racing champion growing up in Bloomington, Indiana. He and his friends were called the "Cutters" -- and they beat a bunch of rich college kids in this big race. It was great. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) Back then, I was a kickboxing instructor... 73   EXT. STREET - NIGHT                                         73 Charlie rides his BICYCLE down the street. Swerving all over the place, he's obviously drunk. Red and Blue LIGHTS flash behind him. Charlie turns to see -- -- a POLICE OFFICER.                                             * 74   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY             74 Charlie leaves Kate a VOICEMAIL MESSAGE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone; seems sort of nervous) So, I got into a little trouble -- drunk in public. On a bicycle. (beat) Um, I was thinking...maybe I need to go to one of those meetings. I'd like to go with you, though. If that's cool. (beat) Let me know if we could discuss it sometime, okay? Maybe you could come over to our -- um, my house? (beat) Uh...yeah. Thanks. Charlie hangs up the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to himself) "Let me know if we could discuss it sometime?" (shakes his head) Such an idiot... 75   EXT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - STREET/FRONT YARD - DAY       75   * Kate and Charlie stand by Kate's car, which is parked in front by the street. She's just arrived. Awkward tension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss our house?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um...yeah. Sometimes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hesitant) Miss me? Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes. (long beat) I've been sober for a year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Kate reaches into her purse and takes out her ONE YEAR CHIP, showing it to Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They gave you that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. A couple of days ago. Tuesday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh...wow. Congratulations. That's really...really...just great. I mean it. (beat) Tuesday is the night I got pulled over. (laughs) Parallel lives, huh? Kate rolls her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So -- you dating anyone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (taken aback) Charlie...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you? Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Charlie seems relieved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me either. Owen keeps trying to get me to be his "wing-man" and it's ridiculous and these girls in bars are so lame and I just keep thinking how I wish I was meeting you in a bar for the first time and I didn't come with any baggage and I could buy you a drink and flirt with you all night and ask for your number. (beat) Wanna go out sometime?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think it's a good idea. Charlie nods. Long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I fucked up, didn't I? Kate looks down, doesn't speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I did. I know I did. I had a beautiful woman who used to love me and now when I see her she doesn't even want to look me in the eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie, please don't do this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I miss you. I miss the way you taste and smell and...I miss things about you that used to drive me nuts! I miss you liking shitty 80's music and fake punk-rock from the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like shitty 80's music. (beat) I like good 80's music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and all I want to do is touch you one more time to just, remember
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to make sure it was real. Silence. Kate looks Charlie in the eyes and gives him a slight smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (changing course) Or...maybe I'm a just a delusional fucking idiot. 76   INT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM/KITCHEN - DAY      76   * Kate and Charlie walk in -- it looks sort of the same, but a number of items are missing, and it's messier. In general, the room looks more "dude."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look really thin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When did you last eat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno -- like...I'm not sure. (seems slightly concerned                           * that he can't remember) I think, um...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should we order something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, yeah -- or I could make a bacon and egg sandwich...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I haven't really been doing the meat thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus. It starts with alcohol. Then meat. (beat) Have you given up fun, too? Kate looks at Charlie -- he's half-smiling, not sure if she finds him funny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (off Kate) Sorry. Bad joke. Kate cracks a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. Bacon and egg sandwiches. But I'm gonna make them. Charlie raises his eyebrows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... LATER Kate's at the stove, cooking bacon and eggs. Charlie goes to the FRIDGE and gets a BOTTLE OF BEER. Kate glances at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. Charlie puts the beer back in the fridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care if you drink a beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Whatever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (thinks about it) No...I'm good. LATER Kate stands by the stove and watches as -- -- Charlie -- who sits at the kitchen table -- wolfs down the bacon and egg sandwich. Kate seems pleased that Charlie enjoys it so much. 77   EXT. KATE & CHARLIE'S HOUSE - BACKYARD - TWILIGHT          77 Kate and Charlie play croquet.                                  *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They look a little tired -- like they've been playing a while. Kate seems to be much better than Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you been playing a lot?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't played in over a year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then how're you beating me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Innate talent? They keep playing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't met anyone even vaguely interesting since we separated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um...stick to the game, okay? Long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been masturbating like crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie -- CHARLIE I miss you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Fine. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could've been killed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (confused) What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Riding your bike -- drunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I wasn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But is that really the point?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are trying to say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) I worry about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughs) Yeah, I can understand that. I used to worry about you. But now I know you're okay. (beat) That makes me happy...I mean, it fucking sucks that you're better off without me but I'm glad you're doing well. No reply from Kate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you move back in if I came to meetings?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should go for yourself, not to make me happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, would you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not moving back in. That wasn't the response Charlie wanted to hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, I should go. It's gonna get dark soon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can always turn the lights on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... Beat.
direction.name: direction
